answers.answer: The main ways to enter Romania, determining legal status, are obtaining temporary protection, having a short-stay right, or being an asylum seeker.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/my-rights and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: The provided content does not detail the process of how one can obtain temporary protection in Romania.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/my-rights and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: A document granting permission to remain on the territory of Romania confirms temporary protection status.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/my-rights and read the section under 'My rights as a beneficiary of temporary protection'.

answers.answer: Beneficiaries of temporary protection can work in Romania based on a residence permit, and no notice of employment or visa is required.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/my-rights and read the section under 'The right to work'.

answers.answer: Ukrainian children have the right to education in Romanian schools under the same conditions as Romanians, including free accommodation, food, supplies, health examination, and Romanian language courses.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/my-rights and read the section under 'Early education, primary and secondary schools'.

answers.answer: Ukrainian students can access higher education in Romania under the same conditions as Romanian citizens by submitting a written request to the university they wish to enroll in.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/my-rights and read the section under 'Higher Education'.

answers.answer: Ukrainian citizens, as foreign nationals from the conflict area, benefit from medical services, supplies, medicines, and devices included in national health programs, without paying social health insurance contributions or co-payment for outpatient treatment.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/my-rights and read the section under 'Medical assistance'.

answers.answer: Separated families can be reunited in Romania if family members enjoy temporary protection in different Member States, or if family members of a temporary protection beneficiary are not yet in Romania and need protection.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/my-rights and read the section under 'Reuniting families'.

answers.answer: In accommodation camps, social services include food, clothing, personal hygiene products, primary health care, emergency medical care, treatment for life-threatening diseases, and inclusion in public health programs for contagious diseases.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/my-rights and read the section under 'Social services'.

answers.answer: Individuals and legal entities hosting people from the conflict zone in Ukraine can benefit from the reimbursement of daily accommodation and food expenses.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/my-rights and read the section under 'Accommodation'.

answers.answer: Ukrainian pensioners living abroad can receive pension payments remotely through the online service Dіya or the Pension Fund's call center, or by confirming their residence through a consular officer at the Embassy of Ukraine.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/my-rights and read the section under 'Pension'.

answers.answer: Individuals with a short-stay status can obtain a work permit by applying for it at the General Inspectorate for Immigration.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/my-rights and read the section under 'Work' within 'My rights having a short stay status'.

answers.answer: Asylum seekers have the right to be assisted by a lawyer and a free translator during the asylum procedure, and can contact an NGO, UNHCR, or the Romanian National Council for Refugees for legal counseling.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/my-rights and read the section under 'Legal counseling, information'.

answers.answer: Asylum seekers can begin working in Romania after acquiring refugee status or three months after their asylum application if no decision has been taken.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/my-rights and read the section under 'Work' within 'My rights as an asylum seeker'.

answers.answer: One can request resources such as food, products, or clothing by registering their request on the website https://sprijindeurgenta.ro/.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/my-rights and read the section under 'Sprijin de Urgență'.

answers.answer: Un Acoperiș offers support in finding temporary accommodation and allows individuals to provide a space to help vulnerable people coming to Romania.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/my-rights and read the section under 'Un Acoperiș'.
